alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Knox; Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 1:41PM CDT until August 12 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Knox County in east Tennessee... East central Anderson County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Blount County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Sevier County in east Tennessee... * Until 345 PM EDT. * At 240 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Clinton to Louisville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Clinton, Alcoa, Louisville, Plainview, Rockford, Halls, Karns, Kimberlin Heights, and House Mountain State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 376 and 400. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 108 and 120. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
